CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "set_translations"
(
    id          INTEGER not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    language    TEXT,
    setCode     TEXT
        references sets (code)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
    translation TEXT
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "sets"
(
    id               INTEGER           not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    baseSetSize      INTEGER,
    block            TEXT,
    booster          TEXT,
    code             TEXT              not null
        unique,
    isFoilOnly       INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isForeignOnly    INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isNonFoilOnly    INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isOnlineOnly     INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isPartialPreview INTEGER default 0 not null,
    keyruneCode      TEXT,
    mcmId            INTEGER,
    mcmIdExtras      INTEGER,
    mcmName          TEXT,
    mtgoCode         TEXT,
    name             TEXT,
    parentCode       TEXT,
    releaseDate      DATE,
    tcgplayerGroupId INTEGER,
    totalSetSize     INTEGER,
    type             TEXT
);

content.text:
The query shows 10 rows but two translations (Chinese Simplified and Chinese Traditional) have the same translation text "核心系列第十版". So `COUNT(DISTINCT translation)` returns 9.

The claim states there are 9 distinct translations of the set name "Tenth Edition", and the data confirms exactly 9 distinct translation values.

```json
{"label": "ENTAILED", "reasoning": "The set 'Tenth Edition' has 10 translation entries in set_translations, but Chinese Simplified and Chinese Traditional share the same translation text. COUNT(DISTINCT translation) returns 9, which matches the claim."}
```
